Art. 4.80.
Heirs appearing subsequently 
Heirs whose relationship to the deceased is not established and who have not claimed their rights within six months of the opening of the succession may no longer contest the validity of acts subsequently performed by the other heirs or legatees acting in good faith nor claim their share in kind in property disposed of or shared by them after that period.
 An heir who has been omitted from the partition may still exercise his rights in terms of value.
